DOC.brief_summary: The primary hypothesis of this trial is that changes in oral vitamin K intake, based on simple food registries, may be superior to conventional changes in doses of medications in order to stabilize chronic oral anticoagulation.
DOC.brief_title: Changes in Oral Vitamin K Intake for Optimization of Chronic Oral Anticoagulation: A Randomized Trial
DOC.criteria: Patients with any clinical indication for chronic oral anticoagulation with one INR level out of target, without a clear clinical cause for INR instability (unplanned changes in coumadin medications, other pharmacological interactions, clinical illnesses and laboratory errors). Clinical evidence of bleeding or thrombosis. INR > 4 or INR < 1,5.
